content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 162.3 - Program approval

State Regulations
(a) In
order to be approved by the commissioner for the purposes of this Part, vocational training programs offered by eligible agencies which are
institutions of higher and professional education shall be registered by the

State Education Department pursuant to Part 52 of this Title. Except as
otherwise provided in subdivisions (d), (e) and (f) of this section, the
standards of instructional quality for the registration of such vocational
training curricula shall be the applicable requirements set forth in Part 52 of
this Title. (b) Vocational training
programs offered by eligible agencies which are registered business schools or
licensed trade schools, shall be registered or licensed pursuant to Part 126 of
this Title. Except as otherwise provided in subdivisions (d) and (f) of this
section, the standards of instructional quality for the registration and
licensure of such vocational training curricula shall be the applicable
requirements set forth in Part 126 of this Title. (c) To qualify for tuition awards to Vietnam, Persian Gulf, Afghanistan and other eligible combat veterans, an eligible
agency other than an institution of higher and professional education, registered business school or licensed trade school shall submit an
application, in a form prescribed by the commissioner, for each vocational
training program for which approval is sought. The governing body of such
eligible agency shall assure in its application for approval that: (1)
administrative and instructional
personnel shall be appropriately certified to teach in accordance with the
requirements of this Chapter; (2)
the program shall be a non-credit program which is at least 320 clock hours in
length and conducted in accordance with: (i) a curriculum approved or developed by the department; or
(ii)
a curriculum approved or developed by
another State agency and acceptable to the department as meeting the
requirements of this Part; (3)

Vietnam, Gulf, Afghanistan and other
eligible combat veterans who are enrolled in programs approved pursuant to this

Part shall be provided the same instruction, materials and resources as are
provided to other students enrolled in the program; (4)
heating, lighting and ventilation of
instructional facilities shall be conducive to learning; (5)
fire and liability insurance shall be
provided for all facilities; (6)
the buildings, rooms or space in which staff and students are housed for any
purpose while attending the program, and all facilities and equipment therein, shall meet the standards, for school purposes, of local fire, health and
building authorities; (7)
equipment
to be used in the program will enable students to successfully use the
corresponding equipment which is used in the business or industry for which the
program will provide training, so that students will have potential to be
successfully employed; (8)
appropriate and accurate administrative, financial and student records shall be
maintained, as well as any other records that may be required by the
commissioner. Such records shall include: (i) registration forms; (ii)
test
data; (iii)
attendance
data; (iv)
records of progress and
achievement; and
(v) records of
student placements; (9)
individual student records shall be easily accessible to teachers and
students; (10)
admission standards
shall be such that individuals admitted to the program have the potential to
successfully complete the program, and to obtain employment related to the
program training; (11)
students
shall be graded at intervals necessary to determine their progress, and shall
be regularly provided with reports of their progress; and
(12)
a student attendance policy acceptable
to the commissioner shall be developed and enforced. (d) All eligible agencies seeking approval or
registration of a vocational training program shall provide assurances that a
record of placement of completers will be maintained and will be reported in a
form prescribed by the commissioner at such times as the commissioner may
require. (e) Eligible agencies
which are institutions of higher and professional education shall provide
assurances that an attendance policy for students enrolled in a vocational
training program which is acceptable to the department will be developed and
enforced. (f) Occupational programs
will be approved only in fields for which there is favorable opportunity for
employment as determined by the commissioner. (g) Approval may be granted for a variance
from standards set forth in subdivision (b), (c), (d) or (e) of this section
upon a finding by the commissioner that the requirements of such subdivisions
will be substantially met. (h) The
commissioner may suspend or revoke approval of a particular program for failure
to comply with the standards and procedures set forth in this Part. Notes
